translation: Good evening everyone. I am Zhang Jun, an Kunju performer of the Xiaosheng role. I would like to send my regards to all the Zaojiu audience here tonight.
transcript: 昆剧小生演员张军，在这里问候造就的各位听友，大家晚上好。

translation: Can you understand what I was saying?
transcript: 听懂我在念什么吗？

translation: Awesome!
transcript: 太棒了！

translation: Please accept my humble respect”.
transcript: “小生有礼了”。

translation: This is my usual opening remarks.
transcript: 这是我惯常的开场白。

translation: On the one hand, on new stages, it is better to test my voice.
transcript: 一来呢，站在不同的舞台上，先小心点儿试一试嗓子在不在家哦。

translation: As performers, we feel physiologically and psychologically assured as long as our voice is in a good state.
transcript: 演员只要嗓子在家，就会激励自己的生理跟心理有一个特别好的状态。

translation: On the other hand, "Please accept my humble" it is an expression of sincere gratitude from me.
transcript: 另外“小生有礼了”，真的是我这位昆剧小生发自内心的一份感恩。

translation: Thank you for joining us, thank you for coming to Zaojiu Talk.
transcript: 感恩你们的加入，感恩大家来聆听造就。

translation: Thank you for sitting here and listening to the story of a Xiaosheng performer.
transcript: 感恩你们此时此刻还坐在这里，听一位小生演员的诉说。

translation: You presence would kindle our imagination, warming up our gathering today.
transcript: 因为你们的加入，让思想碰撞的火花笼罩彼此如此的温暖。

translation: Your participation would breath new life into the ancient culture of Kunqu.
transcript: 因为你们的加入，令古老的历史、悠久的昆曲如此的生机勃发。

translation: At this point, I feel more clearly that you participation will determine our future.
transcript: 此时此刻我更加地明白，因为你们的加入会决定我们的未来。

translation: Kunqu is an art that deserves your participation.
transcript: 昆曲是一个特别值得你们加入的艺术。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Because it is unique enough.
transcript: 它足够独特。

translation: Do you know what the lead melodic instrument of Peking Opera is?
transcript: 记得京剧是用什么伴奏的吗？

translation: Huqin.
transcript: 胡琴。

translation: What is the major melodic instrument of Shanghai Opera?
transcript: 沪剧是用什么伴奏的吗？

translation: Huqin.
transcript: 胡琴。

translation: What is the major melodic instrument of Yue Opera?
transcript: 越剧是用什么伴奏的？

translation: Huqin.
transcript: 胡琴。

translation: What is the major melodic instrument of Yu Opera?
transcript: 河南梆子是什么伴奏的？

translation: Huqin.
transcript: 胡琴。

translation: What about Hebei bangzi?
transcript: 河北梆子呢？

translation: Huqin.
transcript: 胡琴。

translation: What about Wuxi opera?
transcript: 锡剧呢？

translation: Huqin.
transcript: 胡琴。

translation: What about Huaiju opera?
transcript: 淮剧呢？

translation: Huqin.
transcript: 胡琴。

translation: The lead melodic instrument of most Chinese operas is Huqin.
transcript: 中国绝大多数的戏曲的音乐伴奏都是胡琴。

translation: In my view, the traditional Chinese operas using Huqin as the melodic instrument that follow the Banqiang style are actually the "pop music" in traditional operas.
transcript: 而我个人浅显地认为，用胡琴伴奏的这一些中国传统的戏曲音乐，被称为“板腔体”的，是传统戏曲音乐里面的流行音乐。

translation: The melody is the key and should be remembered with ease.
transcript: 旋律很重要，旋律能够被记住。

translation: Pop music has easily singable melodies.
transcript: 能够朗朗上口。

translation: Kunqu is known as "Qupai style" and is compared to Beethoven, Mozart and Bach in Chinese traditional opera.
transcript: 而昆曲被称为是“曲牌体”，是中国传统戏曲音乐里面的贝多芬、莫扎特和巴哈。

translation: A little applause here would be great.
transcript: 此处可以有掌声。

translation: Kunqu belongs to classical music.
transcript: 昆曲完全是古典音乐的范畴。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么这样讲呢？

translation: Because classical music is complicated enough.
transcript: 因为古典音乐够复杂。

translation: Kunqu uses dizi as its lead melodic instrument, which is quite special comparing to the operas that use Huqin.
transcript: 昆曲是用笛子伴奏的，非常的与众不同，不像胡琴伴奏。

translation: So the difference lies not only in the genre but also the texture.
transcript: 那笛子伴奏的不仅仅是个音乐上的差别，更是整个音乐织体的不同。

translation: Kunqu is called "The ancestor of the hundred plays".
transcript: 昆曲被称为叫做“百戏之祖”。

translation: What a great name!
transcript: 多棒的名字啊！

translation: It is as subtle as Kunqu itself.
transcript: 百戏的老祖宗，这四个字就像昆曲本身一样，非常的含蓄。

translation: I admire the English translation.
transcript: 我更爱它的英文翻译。

translation: "Kunqu is the mother of Chinese operas."
transcript: KunQU is the mother of Chinese operas.

translation: You know what is mother.
transcript: You know what is mother.

translation: Indeed, Kunqu is the mother of Chinese operas, the ancestor of the hundred plays, with a history of six hundred years.
transcript: 对哈，昆曲是中国戏剧之母，百戏之祖，有着六百年的历史。

translation: Where did it come from 600 years ago?
transcript: 六百年前我们从何而来呢?

translation: It is so special and it originated in Kunshan, Jiangsu province.
transcript: 它如此的独特，它从江苏的昆山发源。

translation: During the late Yuan to the early Ming Dynasty six hundreds years ago, The tune of Nanxi in the Kunshan region, Jiangsu province.
transcript: 六百年前元末明初的时候，是江苏地区啊昆山当地的一个南戏流传到江南的一个腔。

translation: Was extended to the Kunshan tune.
transcript: 叫做“昆山腔”。

translation: Which does not mean that Kunqu is a regional opera.
transcript: 当然这并不代表昆曲是个地方剧种。

translation: In the following two hundred years, it was passed from generation to generation.
transcript: 之后繁衍了两百年，被当地的人传唱。

translation: During the Jiajing period of the Ming Dynasty.
transcript: 在明代嘉靖年间。

translation: Wei Liangfu and other musicians reformed and developed the tune for decades and the plain Kunshan tune was finally reformed to the Shuimo tune.
transcript: 以魏良辅这个音乐家为首的一大群的音乐家，对它进行了很长、几十年时间的改造，终于把很普通的昆山腔改变成了水磨调，水磨腔。

translation: As for the two hundreds years from the Middle Ming Dynasty to the Middle Qing Dynasty.
transcript: 那从明代中叶开始到清代中叶，这两百年。

translation: Professor Yu Qiuyu had an adequate remark on it.
transcript: 余秋雨教授有个评价非常的形象。

translation: "Kunqu dominated the collective aesthetic consciousness of the Chinese people for two hundreds years."
transcript: “昆曲主宰了中华民族集体审美达两百年之久”。

translation: Speaking of collective aesthetic consciousness.
transcript: 集体审美。

translation: What does the term "collective" refer to?
transcript: 何为集体？

translation: It means that Kunqu fitted the aesthetic taste of people at different stratums of the society.
transcript: 就是一块挺美，对啊，无论是达官贵人还是贩夫走卒都听，都喜欢昆曲。

translation: By the Middle Qing Dynasty.
transcript: 到了清代中叶。

translation: Almost two hundred and twenty years ago, Kunqu began to decline slowly.
transcript: 差不多两百二十多年前，昆曲开始慢慢走向衰亡了。

translation: In my view, it was the involvement of the intellectual that made Kunqun more exclusive in terms of the knowledge required for its audience.
transcript: 我个人的一点浅见，走向衰亡是因为太多大的厉害的知识分子的加入，让昆曲的文化程度越来越高。

translation: At that time, more than two hundred years ago, perhaps a more vulgar art style was necessary.
transcript: 而那个时候，两百多年前，也许需要一个更加通俗的艺术来产生。

translation: So Peking opera, the quintessence of China, was developed by combining the style of Hui opera, Han opera and Kunqiang.
transcript: 于是徽剧、汉剧结合了昆腔昆调，形成了我们伟大的国剧京剧。

translation: We call Kunqu the "Grandmother of Chinese operas".
transcript: 所以你知道昆曲It’s the grandmother of Chinese operas.

translation: Indeed, it has a very long history.
transcript: 对吧，年纪很大了。

translation: In the following two hundred years, Kunqu experienced ups and downs.
transcript: 后来这两百年，昆曲是几经沉浮。

translation: Sometimes it faded out of our sights.
transcript: 有的时候淡出我们的视线。

translation: Sometimes it came back.
transcript: 有的时候被拉回来。

translation: Fortunately, it is still developing despite all the hardships.
transcript: 但是还好它很辛苦，但是它依然在路上。

translation: Then where does the time-honored Kunqu melodies accompanied by dizi come from?
transcript: 那昆曲的笛子伴奏这么历史悠久的音乐，它从何而来呢？

translation: It is so unique because it stemmed from the literature.
transcript: 它是如此的独特，它是从文字里面来的。

translation: The tune patterns of Banqiangti can go with different lyrics.
transcript: 板腔体的音乐在同样的音乐之下，可以唱不同的词。

translation: Offering a popular, easy and convenient way to express our emotions directly.
transcript: 流行、轻松、方便，直接来抒发你的情感就可以了。

translation: Kunqu cannot work this way because of its uniqueness.
transcript: 昆曲不行，因为它太独特了。

translation: If one wants to write a piece of kunqu, take a chapter from "The Jade Hairpin” wrote by Mr. Gao Lian in 1570 as example.
transcript: 如果你要写一段戏，就像这段戏，1570年高濂先生写的《玉簪记》。

translation: There are twenty or thirty excerpts in this play, one of them is called "Flirt With The Zither."
transcript: 有二三十折，其中这一折叫做《琴挑》。

translation: What is "Flirt With The Zither" about?
transcript: 《琴挑》讲一个什么故事呢？

translation: It is the story of a young scholar called Pan Bizheng.
transcript: 一个落第羞归的书生叫做潘必正。

translation: He failed the imperial examination and was reluctant to go back home.
transcript: 他考试没考好。

translation: So he seeked lodging at a temple his aunt was in charge of.
transcript: 他去姑母开的道观中休息。

translation: There he met a beautiful girl who disguised as a nun.
transcript: 他认识了一个漂亮的道姑。

translation: She was actually from a big family and was taking refuge at the temple from the war.
transcript: 那是个假道姑，为了躲避战乱的一个大家闺秀。

translation: Please note that in the Kunju scripts.
transcript: 请一定注意。

translation: If a man fails the imperial examination, it is not a big deal.
transcript: 男生考试没考好，问题都不大。

translation: Because romance will come soon.
transcript: 凡是考试没考好，爱情就来了。

translation: “When one door closes, another opens.”
transcript: 上帝为你关上一扇门，又打开了另外一扇窗。

translation: This is a typical plot in traditional Kunqu.
transcript: 在古代的昆曲故事里比比皆是哈。

translation: This excerpt depicts his crush on the girl after their encounter.
transcript: 那这是写他跟那个女孩儿见到以后，心里泛起了情愫以后的一段戏。

translation: What is "Flirt With The Zither"?
transcript: 何为琴挑？

translation: It is to pass on amorous feelings by playing seven stringed zithers to each other,a very subtle way of flirting.
transcript: 就是用古琴的声音相互来挑衅一下，挑逗一下，但是非常的含蓄。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: They communicated by seven stringed zithers because there was no WeChat nor Weibo at that time.
transcript: 隔空用古琴的声音，也没有微信微博哈。

translation: This play was written in 1570.
transcript: 1570年时候的作品。

translation: If we were to write this story.
transcript: 那你要写这段故事。

translation: We would have to start from the lyrics.
transcript: 你得从文字上开始。

translation: Kunqu Opera has an unique system of verses.
transcript: 文字就是昆曲的最独特的一个体系。

translation: It is called the "Qupai system".
transcript: 叫做“曲牌体”。

translation: What is Qupai system?
transcript: 何为曲牌体？

translation: We have to choose one from the 4,466 melodic models or two or from the three hundred sets of commonly used fixed tunes.
transcript: 你必须在4466个曲牌当中，在常用的两三百套的套牌当中，选出一套。

translation: To suit the logic and emotional expression requirements of "Flirt With The Zither".
transcript: 来符合《琴挑》这段戏的逻辑和要求和情感抒发的需要。

translation: Gao Lian chose the pattern of "Lanhuamei".
transcript: 那高濂就选了一套所谓的《懒画眉》套牌。

translation: "Lanhuamei" is a gupai of Nanqu opera.
transcript: 《懒画眉》是南曲的孤牌。

translation: What is a gupai pattern like?
transcript: 何为孤牌呢？

translation: It means the performers sing alternately.
transcript: 就可以你唱一段我唱一段，你唱一段我唱一段。

translation: Flirt With The Zither used four excerpts of the gupai pattern Lanhuamei and four of The Worship Song.
transcript: 那在琴挑里他用的是《懒画眉》孤牌四段和《朝元歌》的孤牌四段。

translation: So there are in total eight segments.
transcript: 也就是上下一共唱了八段曲子。

translation: Such tune patterns were set by the forerunners.
transcript: 而这样的格式，几乎就是老祖宗严格的要求之下的一种格律要求。

translation: There are strict rules on what to include in each passage, how to perform each passage, and in what order these passages are performed.
transcript: 一二三四五六七八九十这些段，第一段唱什么，第二段唱什么，第三段第四段怎么唱，老祖宗严格的规定的，不可逾矩。

translation: There are some general rules.
transcript: 这是大的套路。

translation: In this sense, Kunqu is so unique.
transcript: 昆曲太独特了。

translation: The second unique feature lies in the details.
transcript: 第二个独特之处是它小的套路。

translation: Lanhuamei has its own tonal pattern and melodic model and has only five lines.
transcript: 《懒画眉》本身自己是有一个严格的曲牌、曲子的要求的，《懒画眉》一定得要五句句子。

translation: Look at this example, one two three four five, five lines in total.
transcript: 看到了哈，一二三四五。

translation: The number of words in each line is 7, 7, 7, 6 and 7 respectively.
transcript: 五句句子的字数是7、7、7、6、7。

translation: Some of you may say the number of words in this passage is 7, 7, 7, 5, and 7.
transcript: 有人说，少了一个字吧，7、7、7、5、7。

translation: It is acceptable to miss one word.
transcript: 问题不是太大。

translation: However, if the number of words in each line is 2, 3, 4, 5, and 8.
transcript: 但是你不能写成2、3、4、5、8哈。

translation: Then the passage cannot be called "Lanhuamei" anymore.
transcript: 那就不是《懒画眉》了。

translation: In addition, the lines should rhyme.
transcript: 然后一个韵到底。

translation: Note that the last syllables of each word rhyme with each other.
transcript: 请大家注意一下，它最后一个字都是一个韵的。

translation: They are the Chinese character "Nong" "Qiong" "Feng" "Meng" and "Hong".
transcript: 浓、蛩、风、梦、红。

translation: If we write "Flirt With The Zither" with a certain tune.
transcript: 看到啊，你如果写《琴挑》。

translation: Then the last syllables of each word in all the 8 passages in the 45-minute play have to rhyme with each other.
transcript: 你用了这个韵，对不起，你整个45分钟的戏全部八段唱全部只能有一个韵，叫做一韵到底。

translation: This is a very strict and unique rule.
transcript: 非常要求严格和独特。

translation: The consecutive lines must rhyme and form antithesis.
transcript: 上下句之间的合辙关系还要非常的顺畅，要对仗。

translation: Read it out and feel it yourselves, "The moon is clear, the clouds are thin.
transcript: 你们读起来听听：月明云淡露华浓。

translation: The flowers are profuse with colors and dew. I lean on my pillow full of worry, listening to the crickets around the walls."
transcript: 欹枕愁听四壁蛩。

translation: The two lines must both have a single internal rhyme and all the passages follow the conventional tonal pattern overall.
transcript: 诶上下句要合辙，所有的曲牌的要求套路。

translation: The rules are so unique and strict in the mean time and we should obey them.
transcript: 如此独特又如此严谨，需要你守护住。

translation: It is not enough to just obey the pattern.
transcript: 如果你只是守护住了。

translation: It would be worthless and meaningless if we cannot fully express ourselves with this pattern.
transcript: 而不能够让你的情感得到最大抒发的话，那是没有价值和没有意义的。

translation: Emotions could still be thoroughly expressed despite the strict rules on composing.
transcript: 于是在这样的规则之下，情感依然是如此的被浓烈地抒发出来。

translation: The moon is clear, the clouds are thin. The flowers are profuse with colors and dew.
transcript: 月亮很明亮，云很淡，露水很浓。

translation: I lean on my pillow full of worry, listening to the crickets around the walls.
transcript: 欹枕愁听四壁蛩。

translation: Do you know what does the word "qiong" mean?
transcript: 知道蛩是什么意思吗？

translation: It means "grasshoppers" or "crickets" in classical Chinese.
transcript: 蛩、蛩、蛩、蛩、蛩，古汉语里面是蚂蚱、蟋蟀。

translation: I lean on my pillow full of worry, listening to the crickets around the walls.
transcript: 我靠在枕头上，忧愁地听着四周都是蟋蟀叫的声音。

translation: Time, location, and environment of the event are vividly depicted.
transcript: 时间、地点、环境已经跃然纸上哈。

translation: The third line is even more beautiful.
transcript: 第三句更加了不得。

translation: It is an allusion, "Saddened by autumn, Song Yu sings to the west wind."
transcript: 第三句是一句典故，“伤秋宋玉赋西风”。

translation: Those of you who are fond of classical culture may find this allusion familiar.
transcript: 喜欢古典文化的人都知道。

translation: However, when I first read the lines, I was still young to understand them.
transcript: 但是我们小时候学的时候真不知道啊，什么意思啊？

translation: Later, I learnt that "Song Yu" was not a jade from the Song Dynasty.
transcript: 后来才知道，哦不是一块宋代的玉哦。

translation: It was the name of a man, a student of Qu Yuan and a literature master of Verses of Chu.
transcript: 原来是楚辞大家宋玉，屈原的学生。

translation: Who wrote a number of poems in the Fu genre.
transcript: 写过很多赋。

translation: His "Deng Tuzi The Lustful" is one of my favorites.
transcript: 我独爱他的《登徒子好色赋》。

translation: Among the beauties in the state of Chu, none are comparable to those in my hamlet.
transcript: 天下窈窕莫如楚，楚之窈窕莫如里。

translation: Among the beauties in my hamlet, none are comparable to the daughter of my eastern neighbor."
transcript: 里之窈窕莫如隔壁那个邻居的女孩儿啊。

translation: These lines may be familiar to most of us.
transcript: 你们都知道。

translation: Another masterpiece by him is called "Xi Feng Fu".
transcript: 但是宋玉有一个非常棒的赋叫做《西风赋》。

translation: Which depicted his melancholic expressions in the fall.
transcript: 《西风赋》对秋天的忧伤。

translation: The author of the play described the melancholic mood of Pan Bizheng.
transcript: 那作者就写潘必正此时心情是.

translation: Who chose to write his sorrow into a poem as Song Yu did in “Xi Feng Fu" and wished the west wind would carry the sorrow away.
transcript: 我没有别的办法，我只能像宋玉一样，把对秋天的忧伤写在《西风赋》里面了，赋予西风了。

translation: This is an allusion.
transcript: 哇，这就是典故。

translation: An adequate allusion has the magic to touch our heart, so people could relate and understand it.
transcript: 典故用得好，是非常非常Touch your heart的一件事情啊，让你觉得特别的舒服，怎么可以用得这么准确呢？

translation: In a way, those of us who are not into the classical Chinese and traditional culture will become more and more unfamiliar to these allusions.
transcript: 但是从一定程度上来讲，离古汉语远的、传统文化远的朋友，会对典故越来越生疏。

translation: As performers of Kunqu, we are privileged to be closer to the traditional culture.
transcript: 我们总算还是近朱者赤而已。

translation: So we would like to share these special excerpts with you.
transcript: 跟你们来分享这一些特别与众不同的篇章。

translation: The falling leaves startle my unfinished dream, I count the flowers on the ground.
transcript: 落下的叶子，惊醒我的残梦，“闲步芳尘数落红”。

translation: I feel like I am following the path of that girl while gathering the fallen fall leaves.
transcript: 走那个女孩儿走过的路，去数地上掉下那些红叶，那些红枫叶的那些涟漪，就像我此时的心情一样。

translation: These beautiful verses, strict tonal patterns, the rigor and the freedom.
transcript: 这样的文字，这样的曲牌体，这样的严谨，这样的自由。

translation: All together created such a splendid work that has been recorded in this way.
transcript: 这样的酣畅淋漓，又被这样的记谱方式记录下来。

translation: This is Gongche notation, a special way of recording.
transcript: 这是工尺谱啊，一种特别的记录方式。

translation: It can also be sung, in a melodious tune.
transcript: 还要被演唱出来，这段曲子非常的悠扬。

translation: Three years after I entered a Kunqu School.
transcript: 我进了昆曲学校三年以后。

translation: I still did not know why I had chosen to perform Kunqu.
transcript: 我还不知道为什么要唱昆曲。

translation: As a farmer’s child who entered this new world.
transcript: 因为一个农家的孩子来到这个天地里以后。

translation: I was at a completely loss.
transcript: 发现什么都是找不到感觉的。

translation: Until I learned this song, a typical Nanqu's pentatonic scale song.
transcript: 直到我学会了这段唱，昆曲典型的南曲的五声音阶的唱。

translation: It is so soft, quiet, and romantic.
transcript: 柔绵、静谧、浪漫。

translation: After learning this song.
transcript: 学会以后我终于有了一个理由。

translation: I finally made peace with myself, Kunqu and the audience sitting in front of me.
transcript: 跟我自己，跟昆曲，跟对岸的观众你们，跟所有的一切和平共处。

translation: Therefore, I think I should sing this passage of "Lanhuamei" for you.
transcript: 所以一定有这样的理由，来为你演唱这一段《懒画眉》。

translation: The lyrics and melody were written in 1550 and stayed the same since then.
transcript: 这是1570年的唱词和旋律，一个都没有改。

translation: Now, with the leading efforts of Mr.Peng Cheng, the excerpt is interpreted in a new way.
transcript: 但是在彭程老师带领的音乐家的编配之下，有一个全新的演绎方式。

translation: We call this style of performance the "Kunplug".
transcript: 我们把它称为叫“水磨调之水磨新调”。

translation: Peng Cheng is the composer of “Serious Snow" sung by Xue Zhiqian and the lyrist of “Battlefield for the youthful" for the talent show "My Hero".
transcript: 彭程老师编配过薛之谦的《认真的雪》，写过加油好男儿这首歌《年轻的战场》。

translation: You probably are quite familiar with these two songs.
transcript: 都听过啊。

translation: He is also the lyrist of "No. 87 of Xiafei Road".
transcript: 还有《霞飞路的87号》，啊你们都听过。

translation: He is the music director of "Kunplug".
transcript: 但是他是我们水磨新调的音乐总监。

translation: He has composed dozens of such songs.
transcript: 做了几十首这样的曲子。

translation: Trying to wake up some far away music styles, melodies and memories with his musical ideals.
transcript: 用我们今天的音乐人的一份情怀，去唤醒这一些久远的音乐、旋律和记忆。

translation: In the seven years since the "Kunplug" was born.
transcript: 在这水磨新调创造的七年的时间里面。

translation: We started from performing in a small hall and twenty days from now on.
transcript: 我们已经从小小的厅堂的演唱，一直唱到在二十天以后的。

translation: We will be performing in Mercedes-Benz Center that holds tens of thousands people.
transcript: 我们的奔驰中心的水磨新调万人演唱会。

translation: With your encouragement, we are moving forward step by step.
transcript: 受到大家的鼓舞，我们正一步一步地往前在走。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: There is not much time left for us to save Kunqu.
transcript: 昆曲太紧迫了时间，对我们来讲。

translation: Do you know how many theatre companies are there in China?
transcript: 你们知道全中国有多少剧团吗？

translation: There are 10,287 in China.
transcript: 全中国有10287个团。

translation: How many Kunqu opera companies are there?
transcript: 知道有几个昆剧团吗？

translation: Only nine.
How many private opera companies are there in China?
transcript: 全中国有多少民营院团，你们知道吗？

translation: There are 8754 private opera companies in total.
transcript: 8754个民营院团。

translation: Over 1,200 of them are private Yueju Opera troupes in the countryside of Zhejiang province.
transcript: 光浙江的乡下就有1200多个越剧的民营院团。

translation: Why there are so many of them?
transcript: 为什么这么多呢？

translation: Because it has a big audience and lots of fans.
transcript: 因为看的人多，喜欢的人多，观众广阔。

translation: Do you know how many private Kunqu Opera troupes are there?
transcript: 你知道有多少个民营的昆剧院团吗？

translation: Just one.
transcript: 一个。

translation: That is mine.
transcript: 就是在下我。

translation: There is only one now, and we probably do not need more in the future.
transcript: 现在是一个，未来也只需要一个。

translation: After all, without enough audiences, the troupe will not survive.
transcript: 多了也没人看嘛，也养不活自己嘛。

translation: Then, there is no use to have more.
transcript: 要这么多干什么呢？

translation: We will have a concert in front of a 10,000 people on May 18th.
transcript: 我们5月18号做万人演唱会。

translation: Do you know why we chose the date May 18th?
transcript: 你们知道为什么放在5月18号吗？

translation: Because it sounds auspicious and we want to be more successful.
transcript: 俗气，我要发。

translation: I was just joking.
transcript: 其实不是。

translation: The true reason is that 18th of May marks an extremely special day for Kunqu.
transcript: 你知道518对昆曲来讲非常的与众不同。

translation: Do you know how many intangible cultural heritages of humanity are there in the world?
transcript: 你们知道全世界有多少个世界级的非遗吗？

translation: The list got longer last year.
transcript: 去年底新评了一批。

translation: Three names on that list impressed me deeply.
transcript: 其中有三个我印象非常的深。

translation: Falconry in Germany, the craft of the miller operating windmills and watermills of the Netherlands and pizza spinning of Naples are all on the list.
transcript: 德国管风琴的制造工艺是非遗，荷兰风车的制造工艺是非遗，那不勒斯披萨饼的制作工艺是非遗。

translation: Do you know what was first one listed as a Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage in the world?
transcript: 你们知道世界上第一个非遗是谁吗？

translation: On May 18, 2001, Kunju was the first to be included as the Masterpieces of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO.
transcript: 2001年5月18号，联合国教科文组织在世界上评第一次人类口述非物质文化遗产代表作，被称为人类非遗。

translation: It topped all the 19 categories that participated.
transcript: 昆曲是19项里面全票通过的榜首，你们知道吗？

translation: 17 years have passed since then.
transcript: 17年过去了。

translation: It has been 17 years.
transcript: 17年过去了。

translation: 17 years.
transcript: 17年过去了。

translation: At that time, my mentor, our manager, Cai Zhengren, came back to tell us about this news.
transcript: 当时我的老师，恩师蔡正仁团长回来跟我们宣布这个消息的时候说。

translation: He said the first good news is that we were attracting attention.
transcript: 一个好消息是我们受到注目了。

translation: As the first on the list of Masterpieces of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO.
transcript: 我们是世界NO.1的非遗了。

translation: We would definitely get more attention and help.
transcript: 会有很多人注视我们、帮助我们。

translation: Indeed, our company stopped borrowing money to pay the performers after the news.
transcript: 果然后来再也不用借钱发工资。

translation: However, note that meanwhile the bad news is we are considered as a "heritage".
transcript: 但同时坏消息是请大家注意，我们是遗产了。

translation: We all know what "heritage" means.
transcript: 你懂的哈，什么是遗产。

translation: For 17 years, we started from performing in a small hall to the Mercedes-Benze Center that holds tens of thousands people.
transcript: 17年了，我们从厅堂走到万人奔驰演唱会。

translation: What is our purpose?
transcript: 想要干嘛？

translation: We just want to prove that Kunqu is still alive.
transcript: 证明我们还活着。

translation: Why are we doing this in 2018?
transcript: 2018年为什么做这样一件事情？

translation: We have been doing just one thing during the past 20 years.
transcript: 是因为二十年来我们只做了一件事。

translation: That is going into the crowd to share with people what Kunqu is.
transcript: 二十年我们深入在你们当中，跟你们分享昆曲是什么。

translation: I remember going on a performance in 1997 when I was fresh out of school.
transcript: 我毕业没有多少年的时候，我记得大概是97年去演出。

translation: We were going to perform Kunqu like what we are doing tonight, four beautiful excerpts.
transcript: 就像今天晚上一样，演昆曲，四个很棒的戏。

translation: However, at that time, Kunqu had a rather small audience.
transcript: 但因为没人看昆曲。

translation: We were performing at a science and engineering college and there were some teachers, medias and students.
transcript: 实在是那个时候，组织了学校里的很多老师、啊媒体、学生，一个理工科的学校，坐下来大家一起看昆曲。

translation: The president of the university locked the door up to keep the audience from leaving halfway.
transcript: 为了防止戏看着看着大家走掉，校长说把门锁起来。

translation: Then the show began.
transcript: 然后演出开始。

translation: The first one was a martial arts drama and was very lively.
transcript: 第一个是小武戏，很热闹。

translation: There were many flips.
transcript: 翻跟斗。

translation: The second show was "Peony Pavilion", an all-time classic.
transcript: 第二出是伟大的《游园惊梦》。

translation: After watching the show for twenty minutes.
transcript: 理工男在看了二十分钟以后。

translation: The students started to get confused, wondering what the story was about.
transcript: 就开始晕了，这是什么呀？

translation: Well, we cannot blame them.
transcript: 也难为他们。

translation: It was hard for them to understand the beauty of lines "Why does Heaven give us brilliant day and dazzling sight? Whose house could boast of a sweeter delight?"
transcript: “良辰美景奈何天，赏心乐事谁家院”对于理工男来讲真的是有点摸不着头脑，

translation: In addition, most of them had to prepare for the examination next day.
transcript: 而且呢其中大多数男生第二天要考试。

translation: But sorry, you can't get out.
transcript: 但是抱歉你出不去。

translation: The doors were all locked.
transcript: 门锁啦。

translation: There was one door left open,but it led to a wall.
transcript: 那边有扇门没锁，但是出去没用，外面是一堵墙。

translation: What the president did not expect was that the wall was recently under renovation and was partly removed.
transcript: 但是校长没有想到，那堵墙最近在翻修，矮了。

translation: So when the "Peony Pavilion" was finished.
transcript: 所以当《游园惊梦》唱完的时候。

translation: Most of the students left by climbing over the wall.
transcript: 大多数学生都翻墙走了。

translation: The reporters followed the escaping audience.
transcript: 然后记者跟出去。

translation: The next day there was an article called "Now, you have to jump off the wall to escape from a Kunqu performance."
transcript: 第二天报道上有一篇文章叫做《现在看昆曲要跳墙而逃》。

translation: For heaven's sake!
transcript: 我的娘呀！

translation: This is what we had been learning!
transcript: 我想我们学了半天，就是这样的一个艺术哈。

translation: This experience led me to find a new way of interpreting Kunqu, a way to which the younger generation can relate.
transcript: 这也刺激了我们应该用自己的方式去跟年轻人解读什么是昆曲。

translation: On December 19th, 1998, in the arched auditorium of Tongji University.
transcript: 1998年的12月19号，我们在同济大学的拱形礼堂。

translation: We used our own methods and created a way to interpret the five characters of Kunqu: Sheng, Dan, Jin, Mo, and Chou.
transcript: 我们这一代人用我们自己的方法创造了一个方式去解读昆曲的生旦净末丑。

translation: We presented its performing techniques: singing, reciting, sitting, and flipping.
transcript: 唱念坐打翻。

translation: We explained the difference roles like Xiaosheng, Laosheng, and Wusheng and the reason why Xiaosheng is furthur divided into Jin Sheng, Guan Sheng, Qiong Sheng and Zhiwei Sheng.
transcript: 昆曲为什么分小生、老生、武生，为什么小生分巾生、官生、穷生、雉尾生。

translation: That night, the 2,500 young student audience echoed with us.
transcript: 那天晚上2500个年轻学生跟我们呼应。

translation: No one left the auditorium halfway, and the applauses were so aloud that it nearly turned over the roof of the arched auditorium.
transcript: 没有一个人离场，把拱形礼堂快要掀翻掉了。

translation: After the show was over, some audience took our poster and rushed to the back stage, talking to us about Kunqu and asking for our signatures. The audiences blocked the back stage.
transcript: 最后大家拿着我们的海报冲到后台去，把后台挤得水泄不通，听我们讲昆曲，请我们签名。

translation: Oh my god!
transcript: 天哪！

translation: I had my idols and I was once a fan.
transcript: 我想我们我们那时候也是追星族哈，去请啊那些那些大大明星签名。

translation: And now someone is asking for my signature!
transcript: 今天我也可以签名了吗？

translation: We were so inspired that day.
transcript: 啊那天开始我们所有人为之振奋。

translation: Because we finally found our own way to interpret the art that we love to our peers.
transcript: 因为我们终于用自己的方式解读我们自己爱的艺术，跟我们的同龄人。

translation: A way that was explored and controlled by ourselves.
transcript: 我们走上了一条自主的、自觉的这一条路。

translation: It has been twenty years since that day.
transcript: 从那天算起已经是整整二十年了。

translation: We hope that in the next 20 years.
transcript: 我们希望用这样的一个二十年的重新的出发。

translation: With your company and encouragement, Kunqu will be even more prosperous.
transcript: 在你们的陪伴之下，能够受到鼓舞，能够把未来做得更好。

translation: Because we have proven with our 20 years' effort that the 100 year-old Yueju Opera is mainly watched by the moms.
transcript: 因为我们用二十年证明了越剧一百岁还是妈妈在看啊。

translation: The 200 year-old Beijing Opera is mainly watched by the fathers.
transcript: 京剧两百岁还是爸爸在看。

translation: While the 600 year-old Kunqu Opera is now watched by the young generation.
transcript: 我们昆曲六百岁却是年轻人在看。

translation: Rather than saying that we have an ambition to stand on a stage in front of a 10 000 crowd.
transcript: 与其说我们发了个宏愿要站上这样的万人的舞台。

translation: It is more accurate to say that during the past two decades, under your encouragement.
transcript: 还不如说在未过去的二十年，在你们的鼓舞之下。

translation: We have finally found the courage to step up on this larger stage to welcome the next 20 years with confidence.
transcript: 我们有了这样的个勇气，站在更大的舞台上来向未来的二十年招手，挥手致意，充满着新的能量。

translation: Therefore, we earnestly invite you to join us and protect what we have achieved together.
transcript: 那恳请你们跟我们一起来做这件事情，是因为我们要守护我们共同创造的景象。

translation: There have been no absolute increases in the numbers of Kunqu opera performers since the founding of the People' Republic of China.
transcript: 昆曲演员在新中国的这几十年里面，并没有绝对的增加。

translation: However, our audience are so young and enthusiastic.
transcript: 但是观众已经变得如此的年轻和踊跃。

translation: You have made this possible.
transcript: 是你们造就了这一些这一切伟大的景象。

translation: Let us do something together，preserving something for the generation to come.
transcript: 我们也一起做些什么吧，为我们年轻一代留下什么吧。

translation: Kunqu has gone through ups and downs.
transcript: 昆曲在当初的时候多么的辛苦。

translation: Now, with the fast growing information technology.
transcript: 而现在资讯如此发达的情况之下。

translation: It is again under the threat of becoming endangered.
transcript: 昆曲又被淹没了。

translation: Where is Kunqu's position?
transcript: 我们在哪里？

translation: Where are we?
transcript: 我们在哪里？

translation: Is it on Douyin?
transcript: 是在抖音里面吗？

translation: Is it on Bilibili?
transcript: 是在Bili里面吗？

translation: I do not know.
transcript: 我不知道。

translation: We do not know how to find the position.
transcript: 我们不会。

translation: Please come to help us.
transcript: 那你们来帮助我们。

translation: Help us to have Kunqu heard at a higher level, in a larger scale and in a wilder space.
transcript: 让我们在更大的层面上，更大的范围里面，更多的空间里面，看到昆曲的声音，留下些什么。

translation: What is the meaning of a concert or decades of routine practicing?
transcript: 那一个演唱会或者几十年的手眼身法步的训练？

translation: What is the purpose?
transcript: 所有的一切到底是为了什么？

translation: Is it for the rewarding moment up on the stage?
transcript: 是为了在舞台上酣畅淋漓的那一刻吗？

translation: I was told that we have sold more than 6,000 tickets.
transcript: 现在他们告诉我卖了六千多张票了。

translation: And we need another 3,000 audience to fill the theater.
transcript: 大概还要鼓舞三千多个人走到剧场去。

translation: Is this important for us?
transcript: 这个重要吗？

translation: It is important, but it is more than that.
transcript: 很重要，但是也不完全重要。

translation: We kept thinking about what Kunqu Opera was.
transcript: 我们一直在想，昆曲到底是什么？

translation: What is art?
transcript: 艺术到底是什么？

translation: I was deeply impressed by what Mr. Tao Ye said.
transcript: 刚才陶冶老师讲的我深以为然。

translation: In fact, art and Kunqu offer an access to the essence of life.
transcript: 其实艺术、昆曲是我们触摸生命的一次机会。

translation: Life is very ordinary.
transcript: 生活是很平凡的。

translation: We practiced our skills for over 30 years, acting in different plays.
transcript: 我们练了三十多年的功，一直在不同的戏当中穿梭、来回。

translation: Hoping to be remembered with some dazzling moments and spectacular roles.
transcript: 希望自己在舞台上留下一个又一个灿烂夺目的时刻和舞台的角色。

translation: However, in fact, we did not truly understand the meaning and the value of the stage.
transcript: 但是其实我们也并没有明白，舞台的意义和价值到底是什么。

translation: It was not until 2015 that we had an opportunity for such a play.
transcript: 直到2015年有机会排了这样一出戏。

translation: Do you know this poet called Zhang Ruoxu?
transcript: 张若虚，你们知道吗？

translation: He was among the more than 2,300 poets, in the Tang Dynasty that had a magnificent history of 289 years.
transcript: 289年的唐朝的伟大的历程当中，2300多位诗人当中的一员。

translation: There are over 50,000 poems passed down from the Tang Dynasty, 1010 by Li Bai, 1400 by Du Fu.
transcript: 唐朝的诗人留下了将近五万首唐诗，李白留下了1010首，杜甫留下1400首。

translation: Do you know how many poems Zhang Ruoxu wrote?
transcript: 张若虚留下几首你们知道吗？

translation: Just one.
transcript: 一首。

translation: This poem is thought as “topping all the other poems in the Tang Dynasty".
transcript: 但这一首被称为叫做“孤篇压全唐”。

translation: However, Zhang Ruoxu is a person with no story.
transcript: 但是张若虚是一个没有故事的人。

translation: How can someone who has no story write such a thought-provoking poem?
transcript: 没有故事的人，怎么会写得出这样一首隽永的诗呢？

translation: I especially loved the last two lines of the third passage, "Who by the riverside first saw the moon arise?
transcript: 尤其是第三行的最后两句我太爱了，“江畔何人初见月。

translation: When did the moon first see a man by riverside?"
transcript: 江月何年初照人”。

translation: Mr. Wen Yiduo said that this poem reflected human's thinking about the universe.
transcript: 闻一多先生说这篇诗作里面，有人面对宇宙时的思考。

translation: In the early Tang Dynasty, the literature style began to change.
transcript: 在初唐的时候，人开始不一样了。

translation: The authors dwelled both inside and outside their poems.
transcript: 既在诗里面也在诗的外面。

translation: However, Zhang Ruoxu has no story.
transcript: 但是张若虚没有故事。

translation: Seven or eight years ago, a 28-year-old playwright, who was born in 1981, wrote a Kunqu opera script in 13 days.
transcript: 81年的你们当中的一员，一位非常伟大的年轻的剧作家，在他大概七八年前，28岁的时候，用了13天的时间写了一个昆曲的剧本。

translation: He wrote a story entitiled "Blossoms on a Moonlit River in Spring" for Zhang Ruoxu, a romance story.
transcript: 他给了张若虚一个写出《春江花月夜》的故事，一段爱情。

translation: At the age of 27, on 16th of the first month of the lunar year, on a moonlit bridge in Yangzhou, Zhang Ruoxu met the girl he loved.
transcript: 张若虚27岁的时候，在扬州的明月桥头，正月十六的时候，碰到他喜欢的女子。

translation: At that time he was 27 years old, the girl was 16 years old.
transcript: 他27岁，那个女孩儿16岁。

translation: They met for the second time on 16th of the first month of the lunar year on a moonlit bridge in Yangzhou.
transcript: 第二次见面，还是在扬州的正月十六的明月桥头。

translation: This time, Zhang Ruoxu was still 27 years old while the girl was 26 years old.
transcript: 张若虚还是27岁，那个女孩儿26岁了。

translation: They met for the third time on 16th of the first month of the lunar year on a moonlit bridge in Yangzhou.
transcript: 第三次见面，还是在扬州的正月十六的明月桥头。

translation: This time, Zhang Ruoxu was still 27 years old while the girl was already 66 years old.
transcript: 张若虚还是27岁，那个女孩儿，66岁了。

translation: After 50 years' obsession, standing in front of the girl he loved, Zhang Ruoxu instantly came to realize the relationship he had with the time.
transcript: 当跨越了五十年的执念，张若虚站在他喜欢的女生面前的时候，他瞬间明白了自己跟时间的关系。

translation: This work and your company led me to understand that the ultimate goal of art is to engage with people.
transcript: 而这样的个创作也让我们在你们陪伴之下，明白了艺术的终极目标是触摸生命。

translation: Some people around us left.
transcript: 我们身边开始有一些人离开。

translation: My father never had the chance to see this play.
transcript: 我这出戏没有能够让我的父亲看到。

translation: I will sing it at the coming concert, and Mr. Li Quan will sing with me.
transcript: 我在万人演唱会上一定会演唱，而且李泉老师会陪我一起唱。

translation: Why?
transcript: 我想为什么？

translation: Because I want to see the people I love come back.
transcript: 是因为我想见到我爱的人回来。

translation: I was not satisfied with my performance in the scene when the 27-year-old Zhang Ruoxu saw his 66 years old lover and their eyes met.
transcript: 27岁的张若虚见到心仪66岁时候，那个四目相窥我一直演不好。

translation: I did not understand the essence of life and time, the meaning of arts until my father passed away.
transcript: 直到父亲的离去我才知道，生命和时间到底是什么，艺术到底将会给我们什么。

translation: When I was performing "Blossoms on a Moonlit River in Spring" at the Hong Kong Arts Festival.
transcript: 我在香港艺术节上演《春江花月夜》的时候。

translation: When our eyes met, I suddenly felt as if my soul had left my body.
transcript: 当我们四目相窥的时候，我突然魂灵出窍。

translation: One line of script from this play suddenly occurs to me, "Through the narrow path of life and death, we finally meet again after this long period of separation."
transcript: 我突然想起了这个戏的一句话，“穿过生死狭窄的甬道，我们久别重逢”。

translation: All forms of great art can give us a chance to reunite after  separation.
transcript: 所有伟大的艺术都在给我们一次机会，久别重逢。

translation: Join us and create such opportunities for the younger generation to come.
transcript: 所以恳请大家跟我们一起，为年轻一代留下一些这样的机缘。

translation: Let us move forward together so that we will never be alone again.
transcript: 恳请大家跟我们一路相伴，让我们的未来不再孤独和寂寞。

translation: Let us see each other and feel our life.
transcript: 恳请大家让我们彼此可以注视彼此的生命。

translation: Let us meet again!
transcript: 让我们重逢。

translation: Let us reunite after a long time of separation!
transcript: 让我们久别重逢。

translation: Let us meet only to love the ones we love again.
transcript: 让我们相见只为了再爱一次。

translation: I invite all of you to join us.
transcript: 恳请各位朋友的加入。

translation: Your participation will determine our future.
transcript: 你们的加入决定我们的未来。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢!
